problems.title: Constrained Subsequence Sum (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
Given an integer array nums and an integer k, return the maximum sum of a non-empty subsequence of that array such that for every two consecutive integers in the subsequence, nums[i] and nums[j], where i < j, the condition j - i <= k is satisfied.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum sum.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5 2
10 2 -10 5 20

Sample Output
37

Explanation: The subsequence is [10, 2, 5, 20].
hintsList: Use Dynamic Programming: dp[i] = nums[i] + max(0, max(dp[i-k], ..., dp[i-1])).
Use a Monotonic Queue to efficiently find the maximum in the window [i-k, i-1].
